alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 11 at 7:47AM PST until further notice by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Kern, Kings and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 815 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 747 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Visalia, Tulare, Porterville, Hanford, Delano, Corcoran, Lemoore, Reedley, Dinuba, Orosi, Earlimart, McFarland, Lindsay, Kingsburg, Farmersville, Exeter, Woodlake, Terra Bella, Woodville and Poplar-Cotton Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
